revised_title: Environmental Impacts and Natural Systems of the North Sea
tldr: The North Sea is a complex ecosystem with intricate relations between physical conditions, water chemistry, sediments, living organisms, and human activities. This article provides an overview of the natural systems of the North Sea, including water circulation, topography, sediment transport, influx of trace constituents, and biological systems. It also discusses the effects of pollution and other human activities on the North Sea environment.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Marine Ecology
